metadata.title: Tueday, 30th June, 2015
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when Shimumbi-Nkoki road in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency will be upgraded to bituminous standard;
(b)    what the cost of the project is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for the project is.
(a)    what the total staff establishment of the Immigration Department in the North-Western Province is;
(b)    what the current staff shortfall is; and
(c)    when additional staff will be deployed to the Province to address the shortfall.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when the following roads in Mpongwe District will be graded:
(i)    Ndubeni-St Anthony; (ii)    Kanyenda-Kasamba; and (iii)    Mpongwe-Shingwa; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in commencing the exercise.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to re-introduce crop levy in order to boost revenues for local authorities; and
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented.

(a)    whether small scale farmers in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency who paid deposits for accessing inputs under the Farmer Input Support Programme for the 2014/2015 farming season, but were not given the inputs, will be refunded;
(b)    if so, when the refunds will be effected; and
(c)    if the refunds will not be made, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Finance whether the Government has any plans to pay diplomats working in Europe emoluments in Euros instead of the American Dollars.
Minister of Home Affairs when police officers will be deployed to Mitete District.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to upgrade Simwatachela Rural Health Centre in Zimba District to a district hospital;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Health what measures have been taken to ensure the sustainable operations of the new laundry equipment at Livingstone General Hospital, considering that the equipment is electronic and highly sophisticated.
